--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Mattias Fagerlund" <mattias@c...> 
wrote:
> Oi,
> 
> Nice work on the game! I had a lot of fun playing around with it, 
but I
> can see how it could become a real time-thief ;) Did you come up 
with any
> new cool features for NEAT in the process?
> 

Actually we did come up with some pretty cool little ideas.  The 
main innovation of course is making NEAT run in real time.  But on 
top of that there were all kinds of lessons to be learned from doing 
something like this.  Most of it has to do with input and output 
representation, though, rather than changes to NEAT itself.  The 
main change to NEAT is making it rtNEAT, which is described in our 
papers on NERO.


> The comments on /. were very favourable also, which was nice also. 
> 
> I noticed that your site suffered the slashdot effect - it went 
belly up
> from the intense load, but that's a common occurance.
> 

Yeah it was really unbelievable how heavy the load was...the whole 
CS department server got bogged down and the main University IT 
infrastructure even complained.  Eventually they actually cut off 
the NERO domain entirely earlier today.  But we have resurrected our 
site now in much better shape since we are providing downloads from 
offsite servers and torrents, so now we can handle all the visitors, 
thankfully.  I spent the whole morning on the phone and email with 
IT people trying to get things cleared up.  (I'm not in Austin right 
now since I'm at GECCO)

ken
